articles.headline: MarketWatch 25 Years: The top 25 market events of the last 25 years
articles.summary: On MarketWatch’s 25th anniversary, we are looking at the 25 biggest market events of the past 25 years.

articles.headline: FA Center: ‘You’ll leave a mess and they won’t think as highly of you.’ Dying without a will is the ultimate selfish act.
articles.summary: Not making a will is a sure way to tarnish your memory, unleash family conflict and waste money on lawyers and taxes that would have gone to your heirs.

articles.headline: Market Snapshot: Why risk of lower 2023 earnings spells bad news for stock market as inflation crushes Fed-pivot hopes
articles.summary: September's hotter-than-expected CPI report is raising the likelihood that corporate earnings next year won't be able to weather persistently high inflation.

articles.headline: The U.S. defense industry faces surging demand and a supply chain crunch
articles.summary: The war in Ukraine and rising tensions over Taiwan have caused demand for high-tech, American-made weapons to surge. Can U.S. defense companies keep up?

articles.headline: Here are all five parts of our series on how to analyze an earnings report
articles.summary: If you want to become a better investor, make like a pro and digest the financials. We prepared a step-by-step guide.

articles.headline: Your Saturday UK Briefing: Kwarteng Out, Hunt In
articles.summary: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter with Allegra Stratton.

articles.headline: Eurowings Pilots to Stage Three-Day Strike Over Workload Dispute
Utah's cookie war heats up in court – and on social media
articles.summary: Crumbl Cookies is suing smaller competitors Crave and Dirty Dough, claiming their brands and packaging are too similar to Crumbl's.

articles.headline: Your Weekend Reading: The 'Worst' May Be Yet to Come
articles.summary: Get caught up.

articles.headline: : Bernanke’s Nobel prize is harmful because it rewards faulty thinking on how banks actually work
articles.summary: Central bankers including former Federal Reserve Chairman Ben Bernanke ignored the build-up of leverage prior to the Great Financial Crisis.

articles.headline: China's Rich New Friend Capitalizes on US Oil Spat
articles.summary: The US economic relationship with Saudi Arabia has been tight for the better part of a century. The origin of the name of the world’s biggest oil company reveals as much: Saudi Aramco is derived from “Arabian American Oil Company.”

articles.headline: Fire Disrupts Services at South Korean Tech Giants Kakao, Naver - Bloomberg
articles.summary: A blaze at a data center disrupted services at two of South Korea’s major tech companies -- Kakao Corp. and Naver Corp. -- keeping their servers down for hours on Saturday.

articles.headline: South African Union Says It Has 3-Year Wage Deal With Auto Group
articles.summary: South Africa’s largest trade union, the National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa, says it has signed an agreement with an automobile group on wage increases for workers that will total 22.5% over three years.

articles.headline: French Fuel Shortages Ease Slightly Despite CGT Union Strike
articles.summary: Supplies of fuel in France eased slightly on Saturday, including in the Paris region, even as the hard-left CGT union extended a walkout into next week at TotalEnergies SE refineries.

articles.headline: HDFC Bank's Profit Meets Estimate on Higher Interest Income
articles.summary: HDFC Bank Ltd.’s quarterly profit rose 20%, almost in line with analyst estimates as higher interest income boosted India’s biggest lender by market valuation, setting the tone for the nation’s bank earnings.

articles.headline: Charting the Global Economy: IMF Warns of Deteriorating Outlook
articles.summary: The International Monetary Fund cut its global growth forecast and stressed that economies are becoming increasingly vulnerable to monetary policy missteps that compound headwinds from the war in Ukraine and sluggishness in China.

articles.headline: China's Communist Party Congress to Conclude Oct. 22
articles.summary: The Communist Party’s twice-a-decade congress will end Oct. 22, a party spokesperson said, setting the stage for a highly anticipated leadership reshuffle the next day.

articles.headline: Miriam Margolyes Swears on Radio 4 as She Wishes New Chancellor Good Luck
articles.summary: Miriam Margolyes has told how she wanted to swear at new Chancellor Jeremy Hunt when she met him in a BBC radio studio just a day after he took up his latest role in Government.

articles.headline: Vietnam to Put Saigon Commercial Bank Under 'Special Scrutiny'
articles.summary: Vietnam’s central bank will place Saigon Commercial Bank under “special scrutiny” after customers pulled their savings from its branches for several days this week.

articles.headline: Turkey Coal Mine Explosion Kills at Least 28, Others Trapped
articles.summary: An explosion at a Turkish coal mine has killed at least 28 people, with rescue operations continuing for 15 miners who remained trapped.

articles.headline: Ukraine Latest: Canada Wants 'Arsonist' Russia Banned From G-20
articles.summary: The Pentagon on Friday announced $725 million in additional security aid for Ukraine. Russian President Vladimir Putin said he has no regrets about the invasion of Ukraine, now well into its eighth month, and that Moscow’s aim isn’t to “destroy” its neighbor.…

articles.headline: UK's Hunt Sees 'Difficult Decisions Ahead' on Tax and Spending
articles.summary: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt said that there are tough choices ahead on tax and spending as he seeks to calm financial markets, after weeks of chaos since Prime Minister Liz Truss came to power.

articles.headline: British Shoppers Stock Up on Frozen Food in Bid to Save Money
articles.summary: British shoppers are adopting a new strategy to try to stretch their weekly groceries: switching to long-lasting goods.

articles.headline: UK Homebuyers Face New Blow as Sales Delays Risk Mortgage Offers - Bloomberg
articles.summary: UK property buyers worried about the surge in mortgage rates have a new headache to deal with.

articles.headline: Your Saturday Asia Briefing: Leading the Dance
articles.summary: Something for the weekend

articles.headline: The Wall Street Journal: Two Trump aides contacted by federal investigators seeking information about movement of documents at Mar-a-Lago
articles.summary: One of the aides, a former military valet who went to work at Mar-a-Lago after Trump left the White House, has reportedly been seen on surveillance footage moving boxes from a storage room before and after investigators issued a subpoena in May seeking the documents’ return.

articles.headline: Biden Administration Begins Testing Student Loan Relief Website
articles.summary: The US Education Department on Friday night began testing the website for student loan borrowers to apply for debt relief, according to a department spokesperson.

articles.headline: : ‘I didn’t co-sign for anyone’s loan’: Herschel Walker rails against Biden student-debt relief plan in Georgia debate
articles.summary: Herschel Walker and Sen. Raphael Warnock butted heads over President Joe Biden's student loan debt relief plan during a Georgia Senate debate on Friday.

articles.headline: Coinbase CEO to Sell 2% Stake In Next Year For Science Research
articles.summary: Coinbase Global Inc. chief executive officer Brian Armstrong plans to sell about 2% of his holdings in the company over the next year to fund scientific research, he said on Twitter late Friday.

articles.headline: Robinhood Pushes Engineer's 'Toxic' Sexism Suit to Arbitration
articles.summary: Robinhood Markets Inc. is poised to succeed in pushing a female former engineer’s claims about a “toxic culture of gender bias” at the company out of open court and into private arbitration.

articles.headline: Washington Watch: Warnock slams Republican rival’s abortion views in Georgia Senate debate: Walker wants to give ‘politicians more power than God has’
articles.summary: Abortion was a hot topic during Georgia Sen. Raphael Warnock and Republican challenger Herschel Walker's debate on Friday.

articles.headline: Apple's Oklahoma Store Is Second to Unionize After Vote
articles.summary: A majority of Apple Inc. retail workers at a store in Oklahoma City have voted to unionize, expanding labor’s new foothold at the world’s most valuable company.

articles.headline: California Governor Blocks Charles Manson Follower's Parole
articles.summary: Sacramento, Calif. (AP) -- California's governor blocked the parole of Charles Manson follower Patricia Krenwinkel on Friday, more than five decades after she scrawled “Helter Skelter” on a wall using the blood of one of their victims.

articles.headline: Bankrupt Crypto Lender Celsius Facing Inquiries From Regulators
articles.summary: US prosecutors and several federal regulators are seeking information from bankrupt crypto lender Celsius Network Ltd.

articles.headline: Instacart Cuts Its Valuation for a Third Time to $13 Billion - Bloomberg
articles.summary: Instacart Inc. is slashing its valuation to about $13 billion and steering clear of a highly anticipated public stock listing until market conditions improve, according to people familiar with the matter.

articles.headline: Biden Calls on Iran to ‘End the Violence’ Against Its Citizens
articles.summary: President Joe Biden called on Iran to “end the violence against its own citizens,” in response to a deadly crackdown by security forces on protests in the country.

articles.headline: Amazon Workers in Southern California Strike for $5 Hourly Raise
articles.summary: Dozens of Amazon.com Inc. workers at a Southern California air hub walked off the job Friday demanding raises of $5 per hour and better working conditions, the latest sign of employee unrest for the online retailer.

articles.headline: Hedge Fund Light Street Capital Falls 50% Amid Tech-Stock Plunge - Bloomberg
articles.summary: Light Street Capital Management joined the crowd of tech-focused stock pickers having a terrible year.

articles.headline: Education Department to begin beta testing for student loan forgiveness application, report says
articles.summary: The Education Department could begin beta testing the student debt forgiveness application as soon as Friday night, The Washington Post reported.

articles.headline: Rupert Murdoch Wants to Put His Media Empire Back Together Again
articles.summary: Rupert Murdoch is exploring options to recombine his Fox Corp. and News Corp. businesses, putting back together a media empire that he split in 2013.

articles.headline: Japan to Take ‘Bold Action’ on Yen If Needed, FX Chief Says - Bloomberg
articles.summary: Japan will take “bold action” to stem currency volatility if needed, issuing its clearest warning yet of possible intervention after the yen touched a 32-year-low.

articles.headline: Bank of Canada's Macklem on Future Rate Hikes, Inflation: Voices - Bloomberg
articles.summary: Here are selected comments from Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem’s press roundtable on Friday in Washington, where he was attending meetings of the International Monetary Fund.

articles.headline: Cramer's lightning round: I'm sticking by Intuitive Surgical
articles.summary: "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer rings the lightning round bell, which means he's giving his answers to callers' stock questions at rapid speed.

articles.headline: Jim Cramer recaps 4 major banks' earnings reports
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase, Morgan Stanley, Wells Fargo and Citigroup reported their latest quarterly results this week.

articles.headline: Your Evening Briefing: A Gruesome Year for the Stock Market
articles.summary: Get caught up.

articles.headline: Starlink in Ukraine and Meta's FTC Troubles
articles.summary: Bloomberg Technology is the only daily news program focused exclusively on technology, innovation and the future of business.

articles.headline: Cramer’s week ahead: Take any chance to sell stocks during a busy week of earnings
articles.summary: Cramer's comments come after stocks fell on Friday to end a volatile week of trading, just one day after the market snapped a six-day losing streak.

articles.headline: Sound On: Trump Subpoena Response, Midterm Debates (Radio)
articles.summary: Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu delivers insight and analysis on the latest headlines from the White House and Capitol Hill.

articles.headline: Warnock and Walker Spar on Inflation, Honesty in Georgia Debate
articles.summary: Democratic Senator Raphael Warnock and Republican challenger Herschel Walker argued over the economy and what can be done to stem inflation while accusing each other of being untruthful to Georgia voters in their first and only debate Friday night.

articles.headline: Africa Must Better Insulate From Fed Shocks, Uganda Banker Says
articles.summary: African nations bearing the brunt of food insecurity and the negative effects of the Federal Reserve’s rate hikes must bolster their resilience against future external shocks, according to the Bank of Uganda’s deputy governor.

articles.headline: The Wall Street Journal: Rupert Murdoch explores reuniting Fox and News Corp
articles.summary: Rupert Murdoch has proposed a recombination of Fox Corp. and News Corp, the two wings of his media empire, nearly a decade after they split, according to people familiar with the situation.

articles.headline: Musk Tweets Complicate US Diplomacy From Ukraine to Taiwan
articles.summary: Elon Musk often wields his Twitter account as a weapon -- threatening to back out of his deal to buy Twitter or insulting President Joe Biden as a damp sock puppet “in human form.”

articles.headline: Tesla Fires After Hurricane Raise Alarm for Florida Officials
articles.summary: A Florida senator is calling for action from the Transportation Department and automakers after a series of electric vehicle fires tied to Hurricane Ian.

articles.headline: U.S. Senate Subcommittee Hearing on MBTA Failures
articles.summary: Baystate Business Hour

articles.headline: Xi's Green China Dream Tested By Weak Economy and Global Strife - Bloomberg
articles.summary: Stimulus projects and a fraught global energy landscape are hindering Xi’s bid for an environmental legacy.

articles.headline: The Wall Street Journal: Nikola founder Trevor Milton found guilty of securities fraud over misleading statements
articles.summary: A federal jury in New York convicted Nikola Corp. founder Trevor Milton of securities fraud for what prosecutors said were his repeated lies about the development of the company’s zero-emissions trucks and technology.

articles.headline: Rupert Murdoch Considers Reuniting Fox With News Corp., WSJ Says
articles.summary: Rupert Murdoch is considering recombining his Fox Corp. and News Corp. operations, putting back together a media empire that he split in 2013, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

articles.headline: DOJ Urges Appeals Court to Stop Trump Special Master Review
articles.summary: The appointment of a special master to review documents seized from former President Donald Trump’s Mar-a-Lago estate was legally unsound and unnecessarily disrupted the criminal probe, Justice Department lawyers told a federal appeals court.

articles.headline: Balance of Power: Is Pardoning Weed Convictions Good Policy?
articles.summary: Listen Balance of Power -Bloomberg

articles.headline: Interest Rates: Bank of Canada Readies Further Hikes Despite Market Turmoil
articles.summary: Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem said uncertainty in financial markets won’t derail his plans to hike interest rates, arguing high inflation remains the “immediate” threat to the global economy.

articles.headline: Truss Brings In Rival Hunt Who Could Steady UK Markets, or Take Her Job
articles.summary: Under-pressure UK Prime Minister Liz Truss appointed Jeremy Hunt as her new Chancellor of the Exchequer, replacing Kwasi Kwarteng after just 38 days in office, in a last-ditch bid to reassure the financial markets she was taking a new economic path.

articles.headline: Emily Roland Drive to Close (Audio)
articles.summary: Understand every aspect of the global economy – and know how to make your next move.

articles.headline: Harsh Logic Prevails for Stocks Twisting in Inflation’s Gale
articles.summary: At times this week, not even a crystal ball into the economy would’ve helped foretell the stock market’s return. Red-hot consumer prices? Stocks rallied violently, adding 5% in a flash.

articles.headline: Truss’s Desperate Bid to Save UK Premiership Lands Her in More Trouble
articles.summary: Boxed in by market turmoil and a mutinous Conservative Party, UK Prime Minister Liz Truss was left with two cards to play: hitting reset on her economic plan, and firing her friend and finance minister, Kwasi Kwarteng.

articles.headline: TaxWatch: The IRS wants you to get your stimulus check and child tax credit cash if you haven’t claimed it — here’s what to look for
articles.summary: The Internal Revenue Service is mailing letters to households that could potentially get money from boosted child tax credit payments and the third stimulus check --- if only they filed a tax return.

articles.headline: Big Banks Kickoff Earnings Season (Podcast)
articles.summary: Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec bring together the latest news from the world of business and finance and the interesting stories.

articles.summary: Understand every aspect of the global economy – and know how to make your next move.

articles.headline: Medieval Times sues performers' union over trademark infringement
articles.summary: Medieval Times filed a suit Thursday claiming that its employees' union is infringing on its trademark.

articles.summary: Understand every aspect of the global economy – and know how to make your next move.

articles.headline: Market Extra: Markets on watch as China’s Party congress kicks off this weekend. What investors need to know.
articles.summary: Investors are going to get some clues from the twice-a-decade Communist Party congress slated to start on Oct.16, where Xi Jinping, China's top leader, is expected to secure his third five-year term as the president of the country and the chairman of the military.

articles.headline: Putin Tried for Years to Stop His Military From Using Western Parts — And Mostly Failed
articles.summary: Previously unreported details from an audit found a push to replace foreign components with locally-made parts in everything from submarines to missiles had fallen short.

articles.headline: Fed’s Bostic Reveals Trading Violations; Powell Opens Probe
articles.summary: Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic said his asset managers made trades that broke central bank rules, leading Chair Jerome Powell to open a probe in the latest chapter of an broader Fed ethics scandal.

articles.headline: Market Extra: ‘This is not QE or QT. This is none of those.’ Why the U.S. Treasury is exploring debt buybacks
articles.summary: The U.S. Treasury Department put an item on its agenda Friday to start talking with primary dealers about the potential for it to buy back some of its older debt to help keep markets functioning smoothly.

articles.headline: : Federal Reserve studying new capital requirements for regional banks amid merger parade
articles.summary: Fed's vice chair of supervision Michael Barr follows through on proposal to take a look at potential systemic risks of bulked-up regional banks

articles.headline: Wells Fargo's third-quarter earnings beat shows why the bank is a key Club pick
articles.summary: Wells Fargo (WFC) reported better-than-expected third-quarter results before the market opened Friday, validating the Club's bullish investment case.

articles.headline: : One chart reveals how sellers are adjusting to higher mortgage rates by slashing home prices
articles.summary: The chart, from Redfin, shows how higher mortgage rates and a pullback in buyer demand, has forced sellers to cut prices to entice bids.

articles.headline: The Video Game That Solved the Housing Crisis — Virtually
articles.summary: Hi everyone, it’s Cecilia. In today’s newsletter, we’re talking about a housing market that doesn’t make millennials groan with frustration. But first…

articles.headline: Puerto Rico’s Board and Utility Creditors Are at Odds Over Energy Tariffs
articles.summary: Puerto Rico’s financial oversight board says it’s still at odds with creditors of the island’s bankrupt power company over how much businesses and residents can afford to pay for electricity.

articles.headline: Chile Ready to Step Up Social Aid Ahead of Recovery, Marcel Says
articles.summary: Chile’s government is preparing measures to boost productivity and stands ready to step up aid to the poor ahead of an economic recovery that won’t kick in before May of next year, the nation’s finance minister said in an interview.

articles.headline: BofA Sees Glimmers of Hope as Pain Lingers for Stock Investors - Bloomberg
articles.summary: Silver linings have begun to emerge in this year’s erratic stock market for long-term equity investors, according to Bank of America Corp. strategists led by Savita Subramanian.

articles.headline: The Wall Street Journal: U.S., allies work to reach agreement on price level for Russian oil cap ahead of Dec. 5 deadline
articles.summary: The U.S. and its partners are rushing to hammer out an agreement on a level for a price cap on Russian oil in the next couple of weeks as they seek to contain global oil costs in the wake of a production cut by the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Companies and its Russia-led allies.

articles.headline: : Why Zelle moves twice as much money as Venmo and Cash App combined
articles.summary: Zelle may not have its own clothing line or suggest emojis when you pay your friend, but the peer-to-peer payment service is moving serious money, and that seems to be raising eyebrows these days.

articles.headline: : What bank earnings tell us about how consumers are doing amid high inflation, recession worries — ‘It’s not a crack in current numbers’
articles.summary: Prices continue to soar as September inflation data came in higher than expected earlier this week

articles.headline: Thomas Rampulla on Vanguard's Mission (Podcast)
articles.summary: Barry Ritholtz looks at the people and ideas that shape markets, investing and business.

articles.headline: US Starts Expelling Venezuelan Migrants to Mexico Under New Rules
articles.summary: Expulsions intended to deter record flow of Venezuelan migrants escaping their country and crossing the US border without authorization

articles.headline: Carvana Files Lawsuit After Michigan Suspends Auto Dealership
articles.summary: Carvana Co. is suing to reverse a decision by Michigan to suspend one of its vending machine-like dealerships over alleged violations of state law.

articles.headline: Luntz Raises Alarm About Election Losers Not Accepting Results
articles.summary: Pollster Frank Luntz predicted that Democrats would maintain control of the US Senate in the November midterm elections and that Republicans would win the House, but said he’s really worried about candidates losing close races and not accepting their defeats.

articles.headline: Market Extra: ‘Growing wealth gap and rising inflation … hurt the global economy at almost every turn,’ Jamie Dimon tells MarketWatch on its anniversary
articles.summary: What a difference 25 years makes. The world is a markedly changed place from the one into which MarketWatch was launched in October 1997.

articles.summary: Leaning into the FIRE movement

articles.headline: Mexico’s Economy Minister Picks Son of AMLO Ally as Trade Chief
articles.summary: Mexico’s Economy Minister Raquel Buenrostro picked the son of a close ally of President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador to take charge of critical trade dispute talks with the US and Canada.

articles.headline: Retirement Weekly: Social Security COLA, Gen X and boomer money woes, and more retirement news and research
articles.summary: For those planning for or living in retirement.

articles.headline: The Margin: ‘Thanks, Hagrid.’ Robbie Coltrane, ‘Harry Potter’ star, dead at 72
articles.summary: The world mourned the Scottish 'Cracker' actor on Friday, who became an international household name playing Hogwarts groundskeeper Rubeus Hagrid

articles.headline: Kroger has to win over Wall Street and Washington on its Albertsons deal – here's how it plans to do that
articles.summary: Kroger and Albertsons must persuade federal regulators, investors and shoppers that the deal is beneficial.

articles.headline: Morgan Stanley's decline on Q3 results is too severe and may lead to a buying opportunity
articles.summary: The stock was punished too harshly for the quarter, given this year's tough macroeconomic backdrop and terrible equity market.

articles.headline: The Ratings Game: Nutanix stock rallies 25% on speculation of sale
articles.summary: Nutanix Inc. shares rallied Friday following a report that the hyperconverged-infrastructure company is looking for a possible sale of the company.

articles.headline: : HelloFresh to close California facility, lay off more than 600 workers
articles.summary: HelloFresh SE, which touts itself as the world's largest meal-kit provider, is laying off more than 600 workers and shutting down its production facility in California, which a spokeswoman said was because the plant is too outdated and its lease was due to expire soon.

articles.headline: How UK Markets Reacted This Week as Told by Charts - Bloomberg
articles.summary: As UK markets careened between shock and relief this week, Rabobank’s global strategist Michael Every summed it up succinctly: “there are many headless chickens.”
